name: Sheraton Centre Toronto Hotel

reviews.text: The Sheraton was not our first choice of hotel in Toronto, but we were switched to it after the original double booked us. As such it proved to be a superb surprise a truly excellent hotel with almost nothing to fault it.
reviews.title: Super Sheraton

reviews.text: The positives were many, three excellent restaurants connected to the hotel, we would specifically recommend Traders as a great casual eating and bar experience. The room was good and we were lucky to get a room on one of the higher floors so were blessed with a fantastic view over downtown Toronto. For what is a huge hotel we found staff both helpful and polite. Good location for public transport, and a good range of tourist attractions.
reviews.title: GreatLocation

likes.liked: — Great location in a great town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Slight negatives, the valet parking was excellent it was slightly expensive. Breakfast again was excellent but a bit hectic and a touch expensive but equally you could have eaten for the day on the buffet if you wanted. One way system in city drove us crazy but we can't attribute that to the hotel.
reviews.title: Big, bustling and impressively efficient

likes.liked: — Comfortable room, good service and great location

reviews.text: Overall the Sheraton gave us all we wanted for the five days we stayed there.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights at the Sheraton Centre Toronto from Saturday 16 June 2007. We booked the room, and our flights to Canada from Scotland, with Canadian Affair in London and I think we got a reasonable deal.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in The Heart of Toronto (20th - 23rd June)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights. Despite early advice that one of us had allergies to feathers, the room had feather pillows and duvet. thank god did check and not rely on the hotel, otherwise I would be hospital bound. Asked for teabags as I am not a coffee person, teabags never arrived for 2 days. this is the new Marriot Service in Downtown Toronto
reviews.title: poor service

reviews.text: Pretty upset. they tried to make it up with cheeze platter and wine. Visit to the hospital would have been disastrous.
reviews.title: Great Hotel with a Great Location

reviews.text: Parking cost $45 per day. Ripoff.
reviews.title: Right in the city centre
Saved our Honeymoon
reviews.text: Please double check your requests especially if you have health issues as these places do not take them seriously unless they end up in court.

reviews.title: March Break
reviews.text: Hotel is located on the PATH, the convenience of the underground walkway was fantastic. We were able to walk just about everywhere we wanted and not need a coat. Would reccommend this hotel if you are looking for a getaway for shopping and seeing downtown Toronto. Pool was fantastic it was neat to swim outside in the winter surrounded by snow! My kids loved it!

I stayed at the Sheraton Centre on a recent trip to Toronto. Getting here from airport is easy, I took the airport express shuttle $40 for a round trip ticket that leaves you at the front door. While in Toronto I did not rent a car because friends told me Toronto is a good walking city. They were right I really didn't need a car. The location of the hotel is excellant within walking distance to numerous attractions. You can also use the underground system called the path to get around. This was really helpful during my visit in December, when it was cold outside I could move around using the Path. The hotel accepts Discover which many businesses in Canada do not. They have a pool and fitness center and I'm not sure it's 24 room service but I was able to order at 2:30am no problem. I plan on visiting Toronto again during warmer weather and will be staying at this hotel again
reviews.title: A Great place to stay in Toronto.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel, really good location plenty to do in and around the hotel and staff are always on hand to help. Rooms where clean and well looked after we asked for high up room so we didn't here the traffic which was great.
reviews.title: Wow what a stay

reviews.text: Restaurant was great, used the travel information desk to book all of our trips and there where really good.
reviews.title: Tripadvisor tips about Hotwire improved our stay

reviews.text: Good location for shopping and all the local facilities.
reviews.title: No need to look any further..........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would defo stay in this hotel again!
reviews.title: Good for downtown hotel

reviews.text: Having holidayed in Toronto previously & visited the usual tourist sites we wanted a relaxing lazy time. We wanted a hotel that was central & the Sheraton is excellent in every aspect.
reviews.title: Summer holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At check in we enquired about upgrading to a suite, $60 per night, our intention was to do this for our second week but after seeing the room we were hooked. Well worth the extra when you have two children. The check in & tour desk staff were very helpful, efficient & we were dealt with very quickly.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: The extra room gives a separate bedroom & lounge with sofa bed. The first night we called housekeeping to make this bed up, the porter arrived with two single beds & full size mattresses. These were fantastic & could be tilted & stored against the wall during the day. As you would expect rooms are cleaned daily & all public areas were spotless. Traders & the Steakhouse are worth trying if you can't be bothered going out.
reviews.title: Great again
Toronto/Sheraton, well worth a visit
reviews.text: By its very name the hotel is close to everything, whether you want to walk to the ferry or take the subway. There are so many restaurants that the best advise is try any, they are all good & prices are much better than the UK or Europe. Shopping is a nightmare, you will do serious damage to your bank account, most items are cheaper than the UK which means you buy more.

reviews.title: loved the hotel
reviews.text: We used the PATH for the first time & found it a great way to move around the city without actually going outside.

reviews.title: Great way to start new year 2013!
reviews.text: Stayed at Sheraton for New Year's Eve. Awesome night. Get there early to check in for New Years as the line up after 3pm was really really long. We were able to check in at 12 with our room being ready. That was a good surprise as we were expecting just to leave our things. Unlike other previous comments, we found this hotel to be great! With a 'romance' package, much more reasonable than just regular room rate at 400.00, we paid 289.00 not including taxes. Package came with buffet breakfast, and valet parking included, with a late check out at 4pm. We were able to bring our puppy, as they were pet friendly. they also provide a dog bed, and treats, which I was not aware of. The outdoor pool really really nice. Great to swim outdoors in the winter, really gorgeous. I thought the staff was great, especially at check in. Guests looking pretty exasperated in lobby with their long wait, but to be expected on New Year's Eve. Paid 50.00 to guarantee view of city hall which was worth it. Able to go indoors and outdoors throughout the night. Beds really really comfortable, and all the usual necessities provided. Clean, quiet rooms, which was surprising for New Years. Heard revellers in the hallway upon their arrival, but nothing once every one was in their own rooms. Silence really. Definitely going there again next year!! Late check out of 4pm a bonus and I think that comes with every romance package booked. Re food choice: Oh, only only order the burgers at the BNB restaurant. We had burgers at lunch outside of Sheraton, so we did not order them for early dinner. Big mistake! Choose not to eat at the other restaurant hotel as even the entrance was dark, dank and uninviting!

We were only at the hotel for one night. While there was a bit of a line to check in, the line moved swiftly and clerk was polite and efficient. Despite booking through a third party (great rate of $77 through Hotwire) we got a high floor (34) with a nice view of Nathan Phillips Square and the Christmas tree and skating rink.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is well situated and easy walking to Queen St and Eaton's Centre shopping, many restaurants and bars.
reviews.title: Plenty of better places to stay at
Good stay on New Year's Eve
reviews.text: The room was clean. The king size bed mattress and bedding were comfortable but not what I would describe as "heavenly". There was plenty of hot water in the shower and water pressure was adequate. Bathroom vanity was on the small side and towel rack was awkwardly placed on the opposite wall to where the shower was. Flat screen t.v. and safe to lock personal valuables in room.
Housekeeping was polite. Did not use pool or fitness facility. Parking is available at City Hall.
reviews.title: they let me down
$49/night U.S. on Hotwire ... What a Deal ... What a place.
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sheraton Centre last summer (2003), in fact, our last night was inclusive of the GREAT NORTHEAST BLACKOUT. The hotel was wonderful during the blackout, offering chilled water and bags of ice at no cost and did checks on everyone at infrequent intervals. I am writing this review now only because I just recently discovered tripadvisor. I booked my room using Hotwire and spent $49 US a night Sun - Fri. All I can say is my wife and I thought this place was absolutely one of the best rooms we have ever had. Down comforters, pillow-top mattress, extra throw pillows, two sitting chairs. We were given a corner room on the 27th floor overlooking the CN Tower ... whew, what a view, and whew ... what a walk up the stairs during the blackout !!. If you go, check and see if you can get a corner room. You get an extra sliver of glass on the side of the building, just enough to create a slight "panoramic" view. This hotel is centrally located, Eaton Centre half a block, Theatre District about 5/6 blocks , Chinatowne 5/6 blocks, Waterfront /Skydome/ Air Canada Centre all 6/7 blocks, as is the Hockey Hall of Fame. Bus and Trolley run right in front of hotel. The one bus that I mention will take you right to the ferry dock for the Toronto Islands Beaches (work on not having any tan lines ;-). Same bus taken from just across the street from the ferry unloading exit will get you back ... how easy is that? What is there not to like about this place ?? Sure if you overpaid for the room, maybe you would find fault. I honestly would pay up to $150/night US and still not complain about this place. Oh , which reminds me ... I do have a slight unhappiness (not really a complaint) ... the pool does seem a bit small for such a large hotel, but it was never overburdened while we were there. But then again we liked the half in / half out of the building pool design and there is a pool bar AND jacuzzi !! Didn't try the restaurants in the hotel. (we like authentic Chinese, Pizza, etc. from the neighborhoods) Believe me, I'm not bragging here, I can easily afford this hotel at published prices ... Hotwire is why I can, but won't ... Thanks Hotwire !! AND GO LEAFS GO !!!

reviews.title: Good Central Location
reviews.text: We stayed here for 6 nights on vacation in May 2004. We found the location to be excellent for access to the subway, trams and for sightseeing. The hotel is business orientated and therefore attracted a number of conferences during our stay, which could be off putting for some visitors. Our room was on the 33rd floor and whilst perfectly acceptable could benefit from an update as the décor and , air conditioning were "tired" and perhaps did not reflect the 4 star rating of the public areas. Staff were pleasant and helpful.

reviews.title: We Were Satisfied
reviews.text: I am a gold preferred customer and when my sister, niece and I go to Toronto we stay here mainly because of the great location and because I am a Starwood Preferred Guest. We have stayed in the Queen Tower and have enjoyed the complimentary continental breakfast --really quite lavish--as well as the complimentary hors d'oeuvrers.

reviews.title: Okay/Average
reviews.text: We find the staff at the tourist information desk extremely fun and helpful. We have found if there is a disagreement regarding our booking, the front desk staff/management have always made it right and to our satisfaction. Perhaps for those who have experienced something less, they need to remember that one gets back what they give! Overall the hotel staff is reserved, yet friendly as tends to be the Canadian custom. We have found the Spa staff very friendly and helpful going out of their way in offering advice on shopping and eating experiences we would enjoy.

I loved that the hotel was next to the ballet (where we were going). Otherwise anywhere I wanted to go (shopping) was accessible via PATH and didn't have to bring a heavy winter coat while I shopped as I didn't actually have to go outside to go from store to store. The hotel's swimming pool was amazing; heated and indoor/outdoor. Given that it was winter, the glass divider was closed to the water's surface, but a quick duck under and I was swimming outside in a warm pool in the middle of winter with the snow falling around me. What I truly appreciated is that I couldn't hear other guests moving through the halls, doors closing, or even hear people in the next room. Comfortable beds and pillows that I would have liked to have taken home.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: I stayed here with my two grown up children, Beds, linen, breakfast and service were all superb. Only downside was the room was too hot and a bit small for three of us! It is easy to get to on the shuttle from the airport. Well located for entertainment and the PATH. We checked in early - - - no problem. Our luggage was delayed from the airport and the hotel supplied a good selection of 'essentials'.
reviews.title: excellent location

reviews.text: We stayed on the 38th floor of the hotel, and the room appeared to be very up to date and modern. LCD TV, Sheraton bed etc.
reviews.title: One of the best properties I have visited.
Disappointing Stay
reviews.text: The hotel is connected to the PATH system, and is right next door to the Eaton Centre.
My wife also wanted me to point out that the channel did have Treehouse TV for children. I also liked the download speeds of the internet.
reviews.title: Great location...room temperature impossible to control
A Wonderful Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel in September 2004 and had a fantastic holiday. Hotel was fab! The room was so much better then i had expected with comfy beds. We had a view of the CN tower which was romantic and beautiful. The hotel was clean and all staff were more than happy to help with a massive smile. I had a factastic break and would return at any time.

Have just returned from a New Year break at the Sheraton Centre. What a fantastic location. Our room (in the Richmond Tower)overlooked Nathan Phillips Square where they held the New Year celebrations and the view was fantastic.
reviews.title: Happy New Year
Excellent place to stay in Toronto
reviews.text: The room had been recently refurbished and was lovely. The sweet sleepers were so comfortable and so many pillows!! The reception staff were all very friendly and check in/out was quick and smooth.

reviews.title: Loved the Toronto Sheraton Centre
reviews.text: Excellent location, linked to the Eaton Centre via the PATH system and so no need to go outside if the weather is bad.
The steak restaurant at lobby level was also very good.
reviews.title: Kinda shabby in the Cabana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed one night in the Sheraton, we got a great deal on Hotwire DOT com
reviews.title: LOVELY Hotel!

reviews.text: The rooms are so clean, the staff AMAZING!
reviews.title: Great hotel, excellent location

reviews.text: The beds were so comfortable! Like sleeping on a cloud!
reviews.title: Wonderful stay. Great service.

reviews.text: Bring a bathing suit because they have a MASSIVE pool!
reviews.title: Great hotel in a perfect location!

reviews.text: You are close to EVERYTHING downtown Toronto, 2 minute walk from the Eaton Center!
reviews.title: Great location and great value

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel on more then one occasion. My boyfriend and I usually book it for occasions such as our anniversary, new years etc. The Sheraton Center has excellent service and very comfortable rooms. The beds are to die for. It is in a good location down the street from the eaton center. I would recomend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in the Toronto area.
reviews.title: Sheraton is the best
Loved the Sheraton
reviews.text: Checked in and was given a room right opposite City Hall. What a view! The large room was newly decorated and in perfect order. Lovely plush fabrics and decor and the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Had both breakfast in the hotel and dinner in the Le Biftheque steakhouse - both very good.

reviews.title: much better than expected
reviews.text: Great location with both the Eaton Centre and The Bay both just a few yards away. There is also access to the PATH (underground shopping) System from within the hotel. Good sized pool and hot tub. Coin operated laundry facilities also available.

reviews.title: If you like the bed
reviews.text: Would highly recommend the day trip to Niagara Falls which also includes a large buffet lunch at the penthouse restaurant in the Sheraton on the Falls hotel. This trip also includes a ride on the Maid of the Mist, visit to the whirlpool rapids and a drop off at the heliport for an optional flight over the falls (stunning). Finally, there is a stop off at Niagara-on-the-lake which is very pretty and not to be missed. Our tour guide was a total gem, she helped make our day very pleasurable.

reviews.title: Sheraton under renovation
reviews.text: I would also recommend Mamma Mia at the theatre and a visit to the CN Tower - go all the way to the Skypod!

I asked for a quiet room, and they put me on the 10th floor of one of the towers away from the ice machine and elevators. I had to spend several hours each day working from my room but this was made difficult by constant thumping and crashing above my ceiling. Construction noise from the street below is also currently a distraction.
reviews.title: Warning: Noisy restaurant above 10th floor; this hotel is popular with drunken hockey fans

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At first, I thought the noise above my room was the maids cleaning, but it went on all day, every day. Finally I took the elevator one floor up to find that the entire eleventh floor is a restaurant! Sure enough, I heard that thumping from above even in the hallway of the 10th floor .
reviews.title: Treated like Royalty from the beginning to the end!!!!

reviews.text: In my opinion, this hotel has no choice but to forget about using that 10th floor for guests. Otherwise they are are really doing their guests a disservice. They are quite a busy hotel, so if you arrive late you will probably be stuck on that floor.
reviews.title: Super Hotel, great staff, what a joy!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Note that this will probably not impact your sleep quality as the noise seems to start around 10 am or later.
reviews.title: Great hotel in excellent location

reviews.text: Another comment about this hotel is that there are quite a few partiers using it when the Leafs are playing hockey, staying up until 3am.
reviews.title: Great down town hotel
Christmas holiday
reviews.text: Having spent Christmas in Ottawa we transferred to the Sheraton for our final 3 nights before flying home. We have visited this hotel in the past and like it for its quality and location.

Check in was relatively quiet when we arrived due to our flight being delayed and we were dealt with quickly from a friendly member of staff. I asked for an upgrade to a Spa room as we were travelling with our teenage son. Not a problem and for $100 a night well worth it. Separate bedroom with jacuzzi bath and flat screen tv in both rooms. Bathroom is a little on the small side, very small sink next to the toilet with little space for toiletries.
reviews.title: Great location, really nice accomm.

reviews.text: Beds and pillows are very comfortable and overall the rooms were very clean but in need of upgrading, looking a little tired.
reviews.title: Location, location, location!

reviews.text: Gym and pool were good and novel to be able to swim outside while snow is falling.
reviews.title: Doors nearly hurt my 2 year old son badly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upgrade to a Spa or Club room, we received complimentary wifi and buffet breakfast for the duration of our stay.
reviews.title: PUBIC HAIR EVERYWHERE

reviews.text: Stayed here on business May 2007. I also brought my husband and 2 kids. Club level room had a phenomal view of the CN tower and the waterfront. Club lounge was nice (but definitely not kid-friendly.) Staff were unbelievably accomodating. Recommend parking valet, though. We parked at the garage next to the hotel and our car was broken into on the last day. The Sheraton staff was immediately helpful. They helped us call our insurance company and even arranged for a mobile glass company to come to the hotel and fix our window. Since we had already checked out of our room they offered us free breakfast at their Bistro restaurant while we waited. The manager stayed with my husband until the repair was complete. He even gave us cookies and bottled water for our trip. We will be Sheraton customers for life!
reviews.title: Doesn't get any better than this!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First off a big thank you to the hotel. I rang up before hand to ask for a room with a view as it was my wife's 30th birthday and not only did the room and view blow us away, we even got a complimentary bottle of wine. Great touch. The room on the 35TH FLOOR (!!) was superb. It was very clean and the king size bed was also very comfortable. The hotel lobby was huge and the bar in the hotel wasn't very expensive which was surprising. We did go to the Sunset cafe for breakfast (as recommended by other tripadvisors) and it was a great tip so thank you. The cafe was only a block or two away on Yonge and Richmond and was very nice and great value. Everything seemed very close by and we walked to the waterfront area and the Steam Whistle Brewery (right by the CN Tower) and i'd recommend both, if you get tthe chance. The CN Tower was absolutely superb and although the restaurant was very expensive it is worth doing if you can. (and besides we sat a couple of tables down from Will Smith and his family!!) Overall a great hotel and great city. Would love to go back and would strongly recommend this hotel and city. The one and only thing wrong is the $35 a day valet parking!! Please take this advice if you stay at this hotel. The building sits on a corner and there is Parking across the road on 3 of the sides that are between $10 - $20 less a day.
reviews.title: Superb hotel in the heart of the city (June 16th -18th)

reviews.text: A busy hotel located in the heart of the Toronto business district. Stayed here in July 2006 for business. Service and amenities are top notch. Expect prompt, professional service. Rooms had comfortable beds, great showers and nice furnishings. Lots of choice for restaurants and entertainment within the hotel. The Sheraton Centre is connected to the PATH Network; Toronto's underground city. Many more choices for dining, entertainment and shopping can be found literally steps from the hotel.
reviews.title: Your typical large downtown hotel

likes.disliked: — The bellhops always had their hands out for a tip!

reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights in June. Excellent location, accross road from City Hall. Large business type hotel with excellent facilities. Lovely bar/snack bar, large open lobby, good size indoor/outdoor pool
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: with bar and loungers. Starbucks and shopping mall on site. Fabulous good size rooms with the trade mark very very comfortable beds. All mod cons with tea/coffee, iron/iron board, air-con, movies e.t.c. Excellent hot/cold buffet breakfast. Overall well recommended central 4* hotel.
reviews.title: The best hotel yet for me

reviews.text: Our late arrival may have complicated matters as there were a few conventions in the hotel that particular week-end. We had booked an accessible room but (I assume) as my bride was able to walk a little, desk staff tried very hard to have us accept a regular room. After the 3rd time I said we needed a room where she did not have to climb over the edge of the bathtub and still they wanted us to go see the room to make sure! I said: "No. Just give us an acceessible room please" after which they did! The 14th floor corner room was very comfortable and offered a great view! Very near the elevator is a bonus. Older design philosophy showed; the safe was exactly where one would hang their clothes in a designed for handicapped closet. Roll in shower was very well designed but the plumbing was old and leaked. Nowhere to put your soap, shampoo, etc in the shower area itself but a little wheeled cart is there so you can have everything near. The mirror over the large round sink is too far and not tilted down so very hard to use. A low mounted mirror on an extendable arm would go a long way here!
reviews.title: Great, central place to be. Accessible room ok but needs refreshing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel staff is great, very helpful information desk attendee as well. Love the indoor/outdoor pool and the 3rd floor spa.
reviews.title: An excellent hotel

reviews.text: We spent 6 nights at the Sheraton, and everything was great. The room was spotless and all the staff were welcoming, kind and friendly. A minor problem with the safe in our room was dealt with immediately and courteously. The location is very good - walking distance of the CN Tower and there is an underground walkway to the Eaton Shopping Centre and the subway. This hotel places a premium on customer service, and we were very comfortable there.
reviews.title: Satisfied

reviews.text: Nice lobby and good underground connections to major shopping. Standard room and furniture. Excellent staff at check-in. Hotel is older, but has extensive renovations to lobby and rooms. Bathrooms and halls could stand a facelift.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights for our first trip to Toronto. It is in a great location, we got our room with a view of Nathan Philip Square, which was beautiful at night. The room is clean and comfortable. The hotel was very busy and crowded though, quite long lineup for check-in. All staffs were friendly. Unfortunately there is no free internet, we also need to park across the street at city parking (but attached to the hotel) to saved half of the price on parking.
reviews.title: Good hotel in central location
Beware hotwire rooms
reviews.text: We reserved a room for a week at this hotel and were very excited about the awesome deal we got on hotwire. Unfortunately, the room they gave us was disgusting. There were spots on the rugs, furniture and god only knows what the stains on our comforter were!! The bedframe was broken and our air conditioner broke during the 2nd night. I complained and was told the hotel was sold out. After the 2nd night, I wrote a letter to the manager and left it at the front desk. We received no response! I took pics with our digital camera of the stains and sent them to sheraton headquarters to advise them of the condition of the rooms. For a minute I felt like a 60 minutes reporter doing a piece on dirty hotel rooms!! ! The evening of our 3rd night, we packed up & drove 10 hours back to CT. Upon check-out, the desk attendant was very nice and tried to assist us and get us to stay; however, enough was enough.

reviews.title: Beware Priceline Rooms
reviews.text: The Sheraton staff was more than gracious afterwards and we are going to try to stay there again this summer.

reviews.title: Fabulous
reviews.text: I will warn not to get discounted rooms...they were gross!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I got a great deal on the Sheraton for 4 nights through Priceline and was pretty pleased. This however changed when I was allocated my room. After winding my way down a dark cold corrider on the 4th floor past empty open small conference rooms littered with the remains of ?lunch/drinks I finally rounded the corner and came to a dead end with approx ½ doz rooms tacked on, one of which was mine. The corrider was dark and freezing and the room wasn't much better.
reviews.title: Great staff and nice new rooms
Great place to stay while in Toronto!
reviews.text: On first inspection the bed was nice but that was where it ended. One of the main lamps had wires sticking out of a bulb hanging out and when I looked out the glass door I discovered that the dead lock to the outside balcony was broken and the door only had a small clasp lock stopping anyone trying to enter from outside. (Although on the 4th floor - the balcony was accessible from the 3rd floor pool deck - the room balcony overlooked this). The room also had an interconnecting door to another room. As a single female traveller this is a no no as far as any other hotel is concerned but the Sheraton didn't seem to take this security into account.
The Sheraton is wonderful.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: We actually changed rooms after our first night becauase we were next to the lift - 1914- and we found this quite noisy but we moved to 1942 the following day. The even numbered rooms face the CN Tower and pool (useful to see your family) and the odd face the City Hall.
reviews.title: Quality accomodation in the heart of the city.

likes.liked: — Freindly and professional staff. Luxurious accomodation.

reviews.text: A lot of people have said to get a room facing city hall (A very impressive building) but we were pleased we had the CN Tower as the clock struck every hour on the old city hall and I imagine you would hear this.
reviews.title: Geat central location

likes.disliked: — too many business people in lobby area!

reviews.text: The steak restaurant, although very dark, was superb value for great steaks. The bar prices were ok for a hotel in a big city.
reviews.title: One of the Nicest Hotels Ever Stayed In

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the staff were so helpful and so friendly.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

description: The Sheraton Centre Toronto Hotel lobby features a 2.5-acre waterfall garden. With over 100,000 sq ft of meeting and event space, we're perfect for your next conference, convention, or wedding.
